intro: Apocynum agglomeratum, commonly known as the clustered dogbane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features opposite, elliptic to ovate leaves that are typically hairy and have a bluish-green hue. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink to purple, with five petals and a distinctive corona. The plant produces orange to red follicles that contain toxic seeds, and it is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks.
